There might be several reasons.   Different versions of the same album are always released simultaneously in Japan, the expensive version with the bonus tracks/ videos, and the non-bonus cheaper version with a different cover(always much more beautiful). For example:CIRCLE CYCLE - Shibasaki KouThe normal version (cheaper, non-bonus, different cover) Amazon.co.jp： CIRCLE CYCLE: 音楽  while the bonus version (more expensive, with bonus disc, different cover) Amazon.co.jp： CIRCLE CYCLE(初回限定盤)(DVD付): 音楽  (images from Amazon.co.jp： 通販 - ファッション、家電から食品まで【無料配送】) The aim of this kind of promotion is obviously to force fans (who wants the two covers and all of the bonus tracks/ videos just like me) to by both of the two version. It is reported that the peak of sales volume always appears after the release of the album, therefore in Japan they usually use the "first-run limited edition recording" with bonus to enhance the sales in the first several weeks. And sometimes bonus track is often used as an incentive to encourage customers to purchase the different version of the album they already have. See this expanded version of Christmas: Special Edition_Michael Buble Special Edition: 音楽 ,with a five-track-bonus compared with the normal version Amazon.co.jp： Christmas: 音楽  . Also different stores are usually offer different versions of the same album. We can always have bonus when we buy music from Apple Itunes Store as you know. In a word, "Bonus track" aims at encouraging customers to buy more.
